gfvoChecker.title: Assess permit exemption under the 2nd GFVO
gfvoChecker.intro: Answer three questions to receive a legally grounded assessment of whether your facility is permit-free.
gfvoChecker.disclaimer:
Note: This tool provides orientation.
It checks whether your business generally falls under an exemption of Viennaâ€™s 2nd Permit Exemption Ordinance.
The result is not an administrative decision or legal advice under the Legal Services Act.
The binding decision is made by MA 36 (Vienna business facilities authority).

category.title: Which category applies to the facility?
category.description: Select the category from Â§ 1 (1) nos. 1â€“13 of the 2nd GFVO that best matches your planned operation.
category.hint: Tip: If none apply, choose â€œNone of the categoriesâ€ to receive an immediate permit-required result.

operatingTimes.title: Do you comply with the operating time limits?
operatingTimes.description: Permit-free facilities must run Mondayâ€“Friday 06:00â€“22:00 and Saturday 06:00â€“19:00 (deliveries until 19:00/18:00).

compliant.title: Yes, we stay within these windows
compliant.description: Operation is limited to the hours specified in Â§ 1 (2) of the 2nd GFVO.

notCompliant.title: No, longer opening/delivery times planned
notCompliant.description: Night-time, Sunday business or deliveries outside the permitted windows are foreseen.

operatingTimes.reminder: Exceptions apply only to accommodation, ice-cream parlours, textile pick-up stations, data centres as well as facilities in stations, airports, ports or approved complexes (Â§ 1 (2) 2nd GFVO).

exclusions.title: Do any Â§ 2 2nd GFVO exclusions apply?
exclusions.description: Check every statement that fits. A single exclusion triggers the permit requirement.
exclusions.reminder: Only if none of the Â§ 2 2nd GFVO exclusions are triggered will the facility remain permit-free.

retail.title: Retail up to 600 mÂ²
retail.description: e.g. shop, boutique or store with max. 600 mÂ² sales area.

office.title: Office operation
office.description: Pure office/service rooms without noise-intensive machinery.

warehouse.title: Indoor warehouse up to 600 mÂ²
warehouse.description: Closed storage for goods or supplies up to 600 mÂ².

beauty.title: Cosmetics & personal care
beauty.description: Cosmetic, foot care, hairdresser, massage and bandagist businesses.

tailor.title: Tailoring & shoe service
tailor.description: Alteration tailors, household-type sewing shops or cobblers.

dental.title: Dental studio/lab
dental.description: Without smelting furnace or only with a furnace connected to a chimney.

accommodation.title: Accommodation (max. 30 beds)
accommodation.description: Hotels/guesthouses without wellness area, offering at most breakfast or light snacks.

iceCreamParlor.title: Ice-cream parlour
iceCreamParlor.description: Catering business operated purely as an ice-cream parlour.

textilePickup.title: Textile pick-up station
textilePickup.description: Drop-off points for dry-cleaning/ironing without on-site processing.

dataCenter.title: Data centre
dataCenter.description: Electronic data processing without own firing systems (emergency power allowed).

insideInfrastructure.title: Facility inside station, airport, port or hospital
insideInfrastructure.description: Facility located within an already approved transport hub or hospital.

withinComplex.title: Small facility up to 400 mÂ² in an approved complex
withinComplex.description: e.g. shop inside a shopping mall with an existing overall permit.

none.title: None of the categories apply
none.description: The planned facility cannot be assigned to the types listed in Â§ 1 (1) of the 2nd GFVO.

externalVentilation.question: Are there outdoor ventilation or AC units?
externalVentilation.description: External fans, AC units or exhaust/waste-heat devices fall under Â§ 2 (1) of the 2nd GFVO.

regulatedStorage.question: Do you store hazardous substances with special legal storage rules?
regulatedStorage.description: E.g. larger amounts of flammable liquids, gas cylinders or LPG requiring specific storage (Â§ 2 (2) 2nd GFVO).

unregulatedHazards.question: Do you store labelled hazardous substances without special rules?
unregulatedHazards.description: Even without specific regulations, storing labelled hazardous chemicals triggers Â§ 2 (3) 2nd GFVO.

loudMusic.question: Is loud music or live performance planned?
loudMusic.description: Anything beyond low-level background music (â‰ˆ 58 dB(A)) counts as music activity under Â§ 2 (4) 2nd GFVO.

ippcSeveso.question: Does the project fall under IPPC or Seveso?
ippcSeveso.description: Large-scale plants subject to EIA/major-accident rules (Â§ 2 (5) 2nd GFVO) remain permit-bound.

permitFree.title: Permit-free under the 2nd GFVO
permitFree.subtitle: All requirements of the 2nd GFVO are met â€“ no facility permit is currently required.
permitFree.note: Continue to comply with the stated assumptions (category, operating times, no exclusions). Any change requires a new assessment or the exemption no longer applies.

permitRequired.title: Permit requirement applies
permitRequired.subtitle: At least one condition of the 2nd GFVO is not fulfilled. A facility permit under Â§ 74 GewO is therefore required.
permitRequired.nextStepsIntro: Submit an application to MA 36 â€“ Betriebsanlagen (responsible regional centre) before construction or start-up.
permitRequired.documentsTitle: Typical documents requested by the City of Vienna
documents: List of machines and equipment with performance/emission data
Site plan, floor plans and sections of the premises (multiple copies)

Evidence for related legal areas (e.g. building, water, labour or fire safety law)
permitRequired.contactHint: Recommendation: Contact the responsible centre in advance (project consultation day) or file a declaratory application if unclear.

reasons.categoryMet: The facility belongs to {category} and is covered by the permit-free categories in Â§ 1 (1) of the 2nd GFVO.
reasons.operatingTimesMet: Planned operating and delivery times follow the limits of Â§ 1 (2) 2nd GFVO.

reasons.noExclusions: None of the exclusion criteria in Â§ 2 2nd GFVO are triggered.
reasons.categoryMissing: The facility cannot be assigned to any category in Â§ 1 (1) 2nd GFVO â€“ a permit is required.
reasons.operatingTimesMissing: Planned operating or delivery hours exceed the permitted windows (Â§ 1 (2) 2nd GFVO) â€“ exemption no longer applies.
reasons.externalVentilation: Outdoor ventilation or AC units trigger Â§ 2 (1) 2nd GFVO, making the facility permit-bound.
reasons.regulatedStorage: Hazardous materials subject to special storage rules (Â§ 2 (2) 2nd GFVO) prevent exemption.
reasons.unregulatedHazards: Storing labelled hazardous substances without special rules falls under Â§ 2 (3) 2nd GFVO, requiring a permit.
reasons.loudMusic: Planned loud music or performances exceed the background music allowance (Â§ 2 (4) 2nd GFVO).
reasons.ippcSeveso: The project is within the IPPC/Seveso scope (Â§ 2 (5) 2nd GFVO) and remains permit-bound.

reasons.externalVentilation: Outdoor ventilation or cooling units trigger permit duty under Sec. 2 item 2 2nd GFVO.
reasons.regulatedHazardousStorage: Hazardous materials governed by special regulations exclude the exemption (Sec. 2 item 3).
reasons.labelledHazardousStorage: Label-required hazardous substances without specific storage rules remain permit-required (Sec. 2 item 4).
reasons.musicExclusion: Music performances or loud sound exclude the exemption (Sec. 2 item 5).
reasons.ippcSeveso: IPPC / Seveso relevant plants are always permit cases (Sec. 2 item 6).
reasons.noFacilityDefinition: No stationary, non-temporary facility â€“ therefore the codex stops here.
reasons.operatingHours: Planned hours exceed the 2nd GFVO window (Sec. 1 (2)).
reasons.areaExceeded: The given area exceeds the threshold of the selected exemption category.
reasons.accommodationBeds: More than 30 beds require a permit (Sec. 1 (1) item 8).
reasons.accommodationBuildingUse: The building is not used exclusively for living/accommodation â€“ exemption condition missing.
reasons.accommodationWellness: Wellness or bathing facilities are not covered by the exemption.
reasons.accommodationMeals: Serving full meals exceeds the breakfast/snack limitation of the exemption.
reasons.expectedImpairments: Â§ 74 (2) Trade Act impacts (emissions, hazards, disturbances) are expected.
reasons.individualAssessment: No clear exemption â€“ request a declaratory ruling for certainty.
reasons.freistellungSummary: All requirements of the 2nd exemption ordinance are met â€“ the facility remains permit-free as long as the conditions are respected.

general.application: Application form for establishing/modifying the facility (signed).
general.description: Operational description covering activity, hours, staffing, traffic, storage, ventilation, etc.
general.sitePlans: Site plan plus floor plans/sections (typically scale 1:100).
general.ventilationPlan: Plan or description of the ventilation/exhaust system including discharge path.
general.machineList: Machine and equipment list with ratings, media, and layout plan.
general.emissionStatement: Statement on noise, air, traffic emissions including planned mitigation.
general.wasteConcept: Waste management concept in line with Trade Act / City of Vienna guidance.
general.wasteWater: Evidence of wastewater discharge notification or permit where required.

sector.gastroExhaust: Hospitality/accommodation: kitchen exhaust proof according to state of the art (e.g. EN 16282-1).
sector.guestSanitary: Guest sanitary rooms per building code (OIB guideline 3, Austrian 'Kellner' rule).
sector.hygiene: Sector-specific hygiene documentation (food hygiene, grease separators, etc.).

labour.roomHeight: Work rooms generally require 3.0 m room height (deviations to be agreed with labour inspectorate).
labour.daylight: Natural daylight openings â‰¥ 10% of floor area; justify exceptions for basements, etc.
labour.ventilation: Natural ventilation â‰¥ 2% of floor area or mechanical systems providing 35/50/70 mÂ³/h fresh air per person (load dependent).
labour.exhaustDischarge: Discharge exhaust over the roof or sufficiently high with filtration (30â€“40 dB(A) at outlet).
labour.escapeRoutes: Escape routes: maximum 10 m to reach a route; ensure cross ventilation if depth > 10 m.
labour.escapeWidths: Escape widths by occupancy: 1â€“20 people 1.0 m | 21â€“120 people 1.2 m | add 0.1 m per extra 10 people.
labour.emergencyDoors: Emergency exit widths: up to 40 people 0.8 m, up to 80 people 0.9 m, up to 120 people 1.0 m; doors >15 people must open in escape direction.
labour.safetyLighting: Provide emergency lighting where no natural light or evening/night operation exists.
labour.staffSanitary: Staff sanitary rooms: at least one lockable cubicle per 15 persons, separate units from 5 female/male upwards, include lobby/ventilation.

operationalDuties.startAfterPermit: Operation may only begin after the permit has become final (Â§ 74 Trade Act).
operationalDuties.periodicInspection: Â§ 82b Trade Act: periodic inspection every 5 years (6 years for simplified procedure), except UMG register facilities.
operationalDuties.inspectionScope: Inspection covers compliance with permit, plans, and co-applicable regulations (Â§ 356b).
operationalDuties.inspectionCertificate: Inspection report must list facility, site, inspector competence, permits, checked regulations, and findings.
operationalDuties.deficiencyDuties: Remedy deficiencies promptly; non-compliance can trigger administrative fines (Â§ 366).

changeDuties.notifyChanges: Significant changes must be reported before implementation (Â§ 81 (3) Trade Act).
changeDuties.operationAfterNotice: Operate modified installations only after the authority's acknowledgement (within 2 months).
